page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO LAMLASH.
page.content: Lamlash is one of the main villages on the Isle Of Arran.The population is 930 rising by a further 1200 owing to the influx of tourists during the summer. Lamlash serves as the main administration centre,having the only council offices,hospital and secondary school.The main police station and one of the two fire stations are situated in the centre of the village. The lowland areas that surround Lamlash are used primarily for dairy farming.The main use of the higher areas is for forestry and some uncultivated moorland. Lamlash takes its name from St.Molios who dwelt on Holy Isle that shelters Lamlash bay.
